revised_title: Observations on the Motion of Urchin Hearts and Disease in Turkey
tldr: The author, John Templer, observes the motion of urchin hearts after being cut out and finds that they continue to pulsate for up to two hours. He also discusses various diseases and medical practices in Turkey, including Il mal d'Aleppo, fevers, leprosy, the plague, and the use of opium. Additionally, he compares Turkish leather processing techniques to those in England.
